citation.article-title: The phylogenetic position of the budding bacteria Blastobacter aggregatus and Gemmobacter aquatilis gen. nov., sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Gemmobacter aquatilis Rothe, Sittig, Hirsch and Stackebrandt, sp. nov.
Gemmobacter aquatilis (a.qua'ti.lis L. neut. adj. belonging to the water, describing its biotope)
Description as for the genus.
Cells are Gram-negative rods with rounded poles; ovoid forms may occur; new cell formation by budding from the distant cell pole or laterally.
Cells 1.0-1.2 μm x 1.25- 2.7 μm; stationary phase cells may be up to 10 μm in length.
Daughter cells may stay connected with the mother cell probably by means of an exopolymer resulting in the formation of short chains.
Not acid-fast, do not form spores or cysts; no prosthecae or other appendages.
Non motile.
Colonies colorless, round with entire edges.

Good growth in medium containing each 0.25 g l-1 Bacto-Pepton, Bacto-Yeast extract and glucose, supplemented with 10 ml l-1 of Hutners basal salt solution (Cohen-Bazire et al. 1957) and 5 ml vitamine solution No. 6 (Staley 1968).
Aerobic to facultatively anaerobic, heterotrophic.
Utilize glucose, maltose, lactose, sucrose, mannitol, ethanol, L-arginine, L-glutamate, succinate, malate, tartrate.
No growth on N-acetyl-glucosamine, methanol (0.5 vol%).
Not oligocarbophilic.
Under anaerobic conditions growth but no gas production was observed with glucose, maltose, lactose, sucrose, mannitol or ethanol; pH dropped to 5.5-6.0 except with ethanol as carbon source.
No formation of gas, D- or L-lactate, acetate or ethanol.
NH+4 and NO-3 but not urea, octopine or nopaline are used as nitrogen source.
Assimilatory and dissimilatory NO-3 reduction positive.
No growth with 90% H2 + 10% CO2 and KNO3 (1 g l-1), or 75% H2 + 10% CO2 + 55% O2 + 10% N2.
Casein, starch and gelatine are not hydrolyzed.
No reaction in litmus milk.
Catalase, oxidase and peroxidase positive.
Temperature range for growth (°C) 17-39, temperature optimum (°C) 31.
Whole cell hydrolizates contain meso-diaminopimelic acid.
Octadecenoic acid is the predominant fatty acid, octadecanoic acid, hexadecanoic acid, hexadecenoic acid, and octadecadienoic acid occur in small amount.
Ribosomal 23S rRNA is nicked.
DNA base composition is 63 mol% GC.

By its 16S rRNA oligonucleotide sequences Gemmobacter belongs to subgroup of the alpha subdivision of purple bacteria and their non-phototrophic relatives. Rhodobacter capsulatus, R. sphaeroides and Paracoccus denitrificans are the closest relatives.
Isolated from a forest pond near Augusta (Michigan, USA).
Type strain is Gemmobacter aquatilis IFAM 1031, DSM 3857.
